meanings.definition: A cluster of short, fluffy fibers or threads attached at one end.
meanings.sent1: The tufting on the pillow made it extra soft and comfortable.
meanings.sent2: She admired the tufting on the rug, appreciating the texture it added to the room.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the tufting on the blanket, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The tufting of clouds in the sky resembled cotton candy, creating a whimsical scene.
meanings.sent5: The tufting on the teddy bear's ears made it look even more cuddly and adorable.

meanings.definition: The act of attaching or securing tufts of material.
meanings.sent1: Her tufting of the fabric onto the chair was done meticulously to ensure it stayed in place.
meanings.sent2: The tufting of the buttons on the coat added a touch of elegance to the design.
meanings.sent3: He tried his hand at tufting the patches together, but ended up creating a colorful mess.
meanings.sent4: The tufting of the vines onto the trellis created a beautiful natural pattern.
meanings.sent5: The tufting of the ribbons onto the gift box made it look festive and inviting.

meanings.definition: A decorative technique involving the creation of raised clusters of fabric.
meanings.sent1: The tufting on the upholstery gave the sofa a luxurious and plush appearance.
meanings.sent2: She learned the art of tufting to add dimension to her sewing projects.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved tufting fabric to create the illusion of floating objects.
meanings.sent4: The tufting of the drapes added a touch of sophistication to the room.
meanings.sent5: The tufting on the wedding dress created a stunning visual effect as she walked down the aisle.
